title: @RiotRepertoir, please change the Garen's ult description before the next patch
body: Really, i hate reading that I deal X damage each Y of the enemy missing health and do the math. Just write 175 / 350 / 525 (+ 28.6 / 33.3 / 40% of target's missing health). It's so much easy and short!

replies.body:
Craaaaaaaaaap, I meant to do that at some point.

Unfortunately, we're past localization cutoff date at this point for 5.16, so it will have to wait until 5.17.

For those that didn't know and are interested in knowing, we have to have all tooltips and other text information completed for a patch about a week in advance of the patch so that they can be translated into all the other languages the game. This is that localization cutoff date. So yeah, I'll try to remember for 5.17.
While you are at it, fix Warwicks passive tooltip. It should say you need to hit the same target to keep the buff stacking (the buff itself correctly states you need to hit the same target).

It's always confused me that Garen's ult has a longer tooltip than some of the most complex and overloaded abilities in the game when it's just a targeted nuke.

Though if you do that, you also need to buff the damage to 30/35/40% missing health, because looking at your tooltip and seeing "28.6% of the target's missing health" is going to be even more annoying than seeing the current overexplained tooltip. Besides, I doubt the extra 1.4% at rank one would be the kind of buff to break him.
